communication.unicast
Interface UnicastClient

All Known Implementing Classes:
UnicastSocketClient
public interface UnicastClient

A generic client-to-server communication client interface (to be paired with a UnicastServer

Author:
Balazs Pete

Method Summary
 boolean createConnection()
          Establish a connection to the server
 boolean endConnection()
          Terminate the connection to the server
 Message getMessage()
          Receive a Message from a UnicastServer (will block until message has been received)
 void sendMessage(Message message)
          Send a Message to the UnicastServer
 

Method Detail

createConnection

boolean createConnection()
                         throws CommunicationException
Establish a connection to the server

Returns:
True of the communication was established successfully
Throws:
CommunicationException - Thrown if an error occurred while establishing the connection

endConnection

boolean endConnection()
                      throws CommunicationException
Terminate the connection to the server

Returns:
true if the connection was terminated successfully
Throws:
CommunicationException - Thrown if an error occurred while terminating the connection

sendMessage

void sendMessage(Message message)
                 throws CommunicationException
Send a Message to the UnicastServer

Parameters:
message - The Message to be sent
Throws:
CommunicationException - Thrown if an error occurred during transmission

getMessage

Message getMessage()
                   throws CommunicationException,
                          InvalidMessageException
Receive a Message from a UnicastServer (will block until message has been received)

Returns:
The Message received
Throws:
CommunicationException - Thrown if an error occurred while receiving the Message
InvalidMessageException - Thrown if the received Message cannot be interpreted
